It seems it was  only last week when he was flying off to the  bosom of his family, when in fact three hundred  and sixty five days, give or take a few -- this  wasn't a leap year was it? The Drivers, who hate this rhyming business, close and lo doors.  A picture of a large wheel of bright yellow chees painted on the doors, along with the words:

dialogues.text: The Drivers move to and enter the cab, as the Foreman wor into a rhyming frenzy. FOREMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, boys, please/ Be careful with that cheese/ For the Beefy Cheese Louise/ If anything should happen/ You'll put me in a squeeze/ You'll bring me to my knees/ I could lose all my fees/ Are you sure you've got your keys? (the truck starts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out for all those trees! Hi-ho, hi-ho/ I hate to see you go/ We'll see you back here soon/ Remember: Newtonville by noon! The truck thunders off into the night, obscuring the last rhymes of the Post Foreman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car is parked behind the sign:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a bright flash of lightning in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUGY "SHERLOCK" WATSON, a heavyset, easy-going Highway P sits behind the wheel, looking up at the sky. DOUGY "SHERLOCK" WATSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred and one ... (pause -- then, more lightning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred and two ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally sits catatonically in his overstuffed chair, with h off, his left arm raised in an uncomfortable position.  A rash under his left arm is covered with pink lotion.  The strewn with Gordie's toy weapons.  Gordie himself is viol stomping up and down on a newspaper-stuffed dummy/enemy s screaming as he guts the dummy and plunges the toy knife brainpan.  GUCCI-GUCCI, the dreaded Pekingese, is busy re of Wally's argyle socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on peanuts in the aisle, as we hear a plastic crunc While everyone else sleeps, the Professor futilely strugg open his salad dressing container with a plastic fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton sits in his '40's noir hotel room, in a sleeveless boxer shorts and gartered socks, cleaning his massive, ch .357 Magnum pistol, staring holes in a picture of Profess Zinzermacher on the table in front of him.  His moll, LOR irresistible, shapely blonde bombshell, lolls on the bed, kisses to the ceiling and watching them float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy slowly cleans the concession area.  Woody sits at a the rink, playing a beautiful, forlorn county waltz on a guitar.  Big Tom is slowly and gracefully skating around in time to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights around the big skate on top of the rink turn o distant waltz merges with the crickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge lightning rod in the shape of a key sits atop the terminal.  A sign on the building reads: NEWTONVILLE'S "BEN FRANKLIN" AIRPORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black stretch limo with a big "A" on the side pulls up the terminal.  The stocky Cockney chauffeur, BOB McNABB, and opens the door for his petite and proper wife, ALICE, out of the passenger side.  Both are dressed in yellow un sport a big blue "A". BOB McNABB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your loaf, luv. ALICE (middle-class English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here, Bobby ducks.  Back in a  tick with Bert, Mel and the Professor. BOB McNABB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standin' by, ready to stab it and steer. Go on, plant one on me boat.  Come on then. She shyly gives him a kiss on the cheek.  He gives her an affectionate hug and tickle, which makes her giggle.  She towards the terminal.  Bob admires her small, shapely fig BOB McNABB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a butcher's; makes me want  to fall to me chips'ns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally Newton pulls into a slot, parks and starts digging mass of Gordie's toys, piled high from the front seat to He retrieves a piece of paper with some flight info on it a huge wad of gum.  The array of weaponry and Gordie-and- generated filth in the car is staggering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice moves through the terminal, past a small newsstand. UP and STAY WITH Horton Thursby, lurking near the magazin sets down the copy of "DETECTIVES IN LOVE MAGAZINE" he wa pretending to read and follows Alice toward the arrival g

dialogues.speaker: A HEINZ 57 COMPANY BANNER
dialogues.text: Near an arrival gate.  The banner reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NUMBER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE off the banner to see Horton walking away, still Alice towards the gate.  We PICK UP and STAY with Wally, enters through a side door, looking for a trash can.  He large conglomeration of hundreds of pink gum wads and oth car refuse.  We stay with Wally until he crosses paths wi of thirty-five robust TEXANS, all in goofy, double-knit l suits, carrying briefcases. Waiting to greet the Texans under the Heinz banner, besid black cauldron are three large CHEFS in white outfits and chef's hats, bearing the distinctive, ketchup-red "57" lo As the Texans approach, a TAP DANCER dressed as a bottle sauce rises out of the cauldron and begins enthusasticall dancing to taped musical accompaniment.  The Chefs shake of the happy Texans and hand each of them a large bottle sauce.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Still looking for a trash can.  Near another gate, he pas welcoming committee, under another banner that reads:

dialogues.speaker: IT'S VERY RICE TO SEE YOU
dialogues.text: MAYOR BILLY BENSON and his wife, DOTTY, stand behind two TWIRLING BLONDS and a TRICK DOG jumping back and forth th hoop.  A Sousa march blares as the CHINESE ACROBATS come plane, all wearing identical Chinese red sweatsuits with collars.  A great deal of bowing and smiling and unintell greetings ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countdown on the satellite continues: it now reads: 0 changes to: 00:09.

dialogues.speaker: INT ARRIVAL GATE
dialogues.text: Wally's at a trash can, trying to dislodge the sticky gum his hands, when he looks out a window and spots Newt in a people exiting a plane down a portable stairway.  Instead crossing the tarmac to the terminal with the other passen stops at the bottom of the stairs and is quickly left alo A concerned STEWARDESS moves towards Newt.  He smiles and The Stewardess stops, Newt stops.  Wally watches.  Within half a dozen assorted AIRPORT PERSONNELL are giving chase who gleefully darts in and out around the plane's landing

dialogues.speaker: HORTON, (NEAR ANOTHER GATE)
dialogues.text: Positioned behind a column, watching Mel, Bert and the Pr deplane off the jetway, where they're greeted by Alice. Bert are rhythmically bobbing their heads and knees, beca have to urinate with such urgency their back teeth are fl

dialogues.speaker: MEL, BERT, THE PROFESSOR AND ALICE
dialogues.text: As the Professor shakes Alice's hand. HUGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Professor Hugo Zinzermacher. Hugo your way und I'll go mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice stares at him.  Mel leans over to Bert and whispers MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta pee so bad I can taste it. BERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, Mel.  My bladder's stretched  out like a water balloon. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you check your bag, Professor? HUGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately no; they took it from  me at the other airport. Alice stares at him again, nods slowly and turns towards claim area.

dialogues.speaker: HORTON
dialogues.text: As Alice, Mel, Bert and the Porfessor pass by, Horton cau follows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The satellite countdown moves from: 00:04 to 00:03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two burly SECURITY GUARDS carry a rigid, smiling Newt up into the terminal to the waiting Wally.  Newt sees Wally, him and breaks into a wild, moonbeam smile.  The Guards c Wally. GUARD #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you his Cousin Wally? WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I am.  Where's his sock? The other Guard holds up a bulging grey sock with a red s Guards set Newt down.  He and Wally immediately start to other, quickly accelerating into faster and faster revolu They stop at the same time and break into huge, identical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMMY "THE STOMP" JOHNSON, a middle-aged black musician i big cigar from the CASHIER behind the counter.  He carrie traveled guitar case, stenciled with the words:

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY "THE STOMP" JOHNSON
dialogues.text: As he moves on, lighting the stogie, HANK THE BARBER, a t man, wearing sleeve garters and a racy bow-tie, exits the Shop across the corridor and moves towards the newsstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The satellite countdown moves under: 00:01 and starts cou seconds: 00:00:59.  The satellite begins emitting a beepi which gradually increases in tempo, pitch and volume.  An slides open and a large, metallic nozzle slides out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baggage carousel starts revolving and bags begin to a see the following groupings:  Alice, the Professor, Mel a MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be right back. BERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the men's room. They begin fast-bobbing towards the men's room.  Sammy "T Johnson waits just to the right of Alice, who takes out a mirror and powders her nose.  Horton lurks behind a nearb watching the Professor. The Texans and the Chinese Acrobats are on opposite sides carousel, along with their respective welcoming committee Wally leads Newt to the carousel, takes off his belt, loo though the handle on Newt's jacket and ties it around a c NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I pee? WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as I get your bag, Newt. NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock' em-sock'em? WALLY (hands Newt his sock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back, Newt.  I see your  bag right there. Wally starts after a plaid bag with a "SOOTHING BREEZES" it, trying to dart through the Texans to reach the bag be disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the satellite countdown:  00:00:03 / 00:00:02 / 00 and as it hits 00:00:00 the beeping crescendos and goes  SILENT for one brief moment.  Then, the satellite produce an emission.; a small burst of light shoots from the nozz and hear a sound like a sharp slam on a ping-pong ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE, looking down on the United States.  The emiss short piece of light, enters the earth's atmosphere and h towards Kansas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emission strikes the Ben Franklin key on top of the t The key lights up and spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE, looking down on the carousel area.  The emiss down, strikes the carousel and a glowing four-way beam in shape of a "X" appears.  One arm of the "X" connects Hort Thursby and Wally Newton; the other arm connects Professo Zinzermacher and Newt Newton. The glowing "X" vibrates wildly and spins, sending off sm of the emission in various directions. One piece hits the group of Texans, bounces over and stri Chinese Acrobats. Another shard hits Alice, makes a sharp right and slams i "The Stomp" Johnson. A third bolt hits Alice's open make-up mirror, bounces be and nails Mel and Bert just as they open the door to the This piece of the emission then hits the mirror in the me and shoots back out into the corridor, striking the Cashi the Barber at the newsstand. The bolt continues out an open door, bounces off the thre Chefs, the tap dancing 57 Sauce Bottle and the Trick Dog, standing by the curb, then smacks into the head of Bob Mc sitting behind the wheel of Company "A"'s limo. From there, the beam spreads out towards all of Newtonvil The three Chefs, the tap dancing Bottle and the Trick Dog suddenly compelled to leap into Bob's limo.  And Bob, as possessed by the spirit of a mad hot rodder, puts the ped metal, lays two hundred feet of rubber, slams on the brea reaches a stop sign, throws it in reverse and comes roari backwards through the pick-up area in front of the termin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing "X" of light burns brightly; the clothes of t opposing pairs fly off and land on the person opposite; N wears the Professor's clothes and the Professor is wearin clothes.  Horton Thursby is wearing Wally Newton's clothe Newton is wearing the clothes of Horton Thursby.  Newt's into the Professor's hand.  He immediately drops it.  Hor Magnum flies across and lands in Wally's hand.  He immedi it. The "X" hits another level of intensity and now the two p literally change places; Newt Newton, in the Professor's now stands next to Alice.  He leans down and picks up his Professor is in Newt's clothes, strapped to the column. Horton's clothes, lurking behind a column and Horton wear clothes, looking for Newt's bag.  Horton bends down, pick Magnum and sticks it in the waistband of his pants. The "X" hits its brightest level and completely EVAPORATE carousel makes a stressful, screeching sound. Newt, the Professor, Wally and Horton blink their eyes an their heads, feeling confused. For no reason they can understand, the Texans are compell en mass to the other side of the carousel, just as the Ch acrobats, equally befuddled and compelled, walk around to Texans were standing. Alice and Sammy "The Stomp" Johnson are still standing si However, their positions have been reversed, she's wearin sharkskin suit and aviator shades and he's wearing her Co dress suit. The carousel stops suddenly, smoking slightly.  Stunned s Mayor Billy Benson is the first person who rouses himself speak.  He makes a few strange noises, before squeezing o words ... MAYOR BILLY BENSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It-it-it-it-it was only lightning. Stay c-c-c-c-calm. The crowd, instantly reassured and pathetically grateful convenient explanation, murmurs, as one ... CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was only lightning. The carousel slowly starts to revolve again.  People begi forward to claim their luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel and Bert, who had been frozen near the door, shake th clear and bob to the urinals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank the Barber picks up a newspaper and hands it to the CASHIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hank, usual? HANK THE BARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you. The Cashier takes the paper, opens the cash register draw tries to stuff the newspaper inside.  Meanwhile, Hank unw candy bar and smears it in a tight circle on his forehead third eye area.  The Cashier takes out a handful of nicke dimes, holds out his arm and throws the coins onto the co floor.  The Barber and the Cashier look at each other for with a look of complete blankness.  The Barber spins viol storms back to the Barbershop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The satellite emission beam zips towards the "Welcome to  Newtonville" sign, hits the city limits, stops dead, glow for a second, then disappears with a loud pop.  A moment semi-tractor trailer barrels down the highway, entering N On it's back doors we see the words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High angle.  Stock shot.  Establish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a high-tech security door, with a sign that read SDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING along a heavily instrumented control panel, we com on a blinking, and as yet undetected, red warning light. above the light reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton-as-Wally, undoes the belt that holds the Professor the column.  He hands the plaid bag to the Professor. HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go, Newt. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? HORTON-AS-WALLY (slight pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Manor? THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we would go to the ... Institute. HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just came from the Institute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. They start towards an exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy "The Stomp"-as-Alice takes Newt-as-the-Professor by SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, Professor Zinzermacher. Newt-as-the-Professor smiles, grips his sock and they mar the exit.  Stepping out from behind the column, Wally-as- shadows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy "The Stomp"-as-Alice and Newt-as-the-Professor exit terminal to the white zone and stop at the curb.  Wally-a exits after them, hanging back behind a trolly of luggage later the Company "A" limousine rockets by, the top of th Dancing 57 Bottle sticks out of the sunroof.  The limo sc a halt at the same stop sign, then shoots back past the w again, 70 mph in reverse, tires smoking and screaming. SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE (after the limo passes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is my husband doing? Newt-as-the-Professor stares blissfully.  Mel and Bert co out of the terminal.  Due to the peculiar nature of the s emission, they, along with everyone else affected by it, dimly aware that any changes have occurred. MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry we're late, Alice. A slight pause.  They both look at her somewhat curiously dismiss whatever doubt might have arisen. MEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were bobbin' like a cork. BERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd been holding our water since Zurich. The limo roars by yet again at 95 mph. MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Bob going? Sammy "The Stomp"-as-Alice takes out a white hankie, step curb.  He speaks in his voice, but with Alice's accent an vocabulary. SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE (waving the hankie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoo-hoo!  Bobby!  Ducks!  Oh, ducks, come  right over here now, we're all ready to go. The limo screams back into view, stops on a dime.  Bob Mc desperate man, a vessel for a twisted A.J. Foyt from Hell "good" side controls the foot on the break, the "demonic" the accelerator like Buddy Righ assaulting his bass drum entire car shakes and smokes like a dragster on the start BOB McNABB (eyes popping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump in, Mates, and make it snappy;  I'm ridin' a rhino in a brushfire. Doors fly open, Mel and Bert lift Newt-as-the-Professor i back seat with them, wedging in between the Chefs and the Dancing Bottle.  Stricken with a profound love, the Trick instantly leaps into Newt-as-the-Professor's arms.  Equal infatuated, Newt-as-the-Professor grabs the little Dog's they smile at each other, point blank.  Sammy "The Stomp" climbs into the front seat beside Bob. SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE (a bit stern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robby-ducks, remind me to speak to you  about your tea consumption.  It seems  to be affecting your driving -- Bob can't hold back the surge any longer and the limo lea like a cheetah on the trail of a leaping ibex.  Wally-as- forward to the curb, hails a cab, jumps in the back and s

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: WALLY-AS-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow that limo! The cab starts after the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor-as-Newt stands by, as Horton-as-Wally opens to Wally's car.  Enraged with revulsion, he reaches in an or three violent motions sweeps Gordie's toys and Polly's out of the car, spraying it into the parking lot. HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a load a' crap. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it would seem. Horton-as-Wally looks at him askance for a moment, then o door for the Professor-as-Newt, places him in the front s fastens his seat belt. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling we're not in Zurich  anymore. HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said a mouthful there, buddy. Horton-as-Wally starts the car and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo zooms towards an intersection.  The light ahead Bob slams on the breaks.  The passengers tumble like ten- throws the limo into reverse and floors it.  The passenge regaining their balance, get thrown again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taxi Driver reacts in horror as the limo shoots backw him.  Panicked, he puts the cab in reverse and floors it. Horton holds on for dear life.   WALLY-AS-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we do something wrong? CAB DRIVER (nonchalant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see this sort'a stuff every day; the whole world's comin' apart. The limo shoots back past them, swerves, does a 360 and h straight for them.  The Cab Driver shifts back to drive a rubber, the limo right on his rear fender. CAB DRIVER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta admit though, this one's somethin'  special. The cab is pushed forward down the road by the limo.  The over the crest of a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A palatial estate, high on a hill, hard by the sixteenth Newtonville Country Club golf course.  A sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the grand foyer, at the base of a grand, circular stai TIDMAN, a nervous, middle-aged, slightly disheveled butle addressing the assembled Manor STAFF. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know ... Newt ... is coming home.  He will be arriving momentarily.  You  will recall two years ago, due to a  former employee's negligence, one of  the garages was not secured.  Newt  crawled into the workings of the furnace;  during the six months it took to undo  his handiwork we suffered through the  coldest winter in recent memory.  Black  smoke issued from the faucets.  Boiling  water was found in the toilets.  Thermostat  circuitry was hardwired to all the baking  ovens.  Yes, as a result Chef Pierre did  develop his "Jiffy Baked Alaska", which  we've all enjoyed, he also developed a  rare skin disorder from working in the  113 degree kitchen. A sheepish CHEF PIERRE, wearing heavy medical mittens and asbestos ear flaps, shrugs. CHEF PIERRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cis la'vie. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the following words engraved in  the core of your beings: this year there  will be no such incidents.  If air can  reach a hidden place, so can Newt.  If water  can flow through a crack, there too Newt  will go.  Readiness.  Vigilance.  Perseverance.   May God be with us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick CUTS: Fine crockery's locked in high cabinets.  Hal doors are nailed shut.  Iron grates are padlocked over ai In the garage, a steel box is lowered by winch over the R the basement, a GUARD takes his post in front of the new

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electric gates swing open.  Horton-as-Wally drives Wa up the circular drive to the front walk.  Tidman approach flanked by a pair of Orderlies -- IKE and MIKE -- built l refrigerators.  Tidman opens the door, Ike and Mike stand pounce.  The Professor-as-Newt looks up at them and smile as-Wally gets out on the driver's side. TIDMAN (a big cheesy smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Master Newt.  Hello, Wally. HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are the goons? TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help for you-know-who.  Come along,  Newt, we've got the Rocking Horse  room all ready for you. The Orderlies lift the Professor-as-Newt out of the car. at them benignly. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two big assistants.  This is good. TIDMAN (shocked, to Wally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a tremendous improvement. (goes to the Professor-as-Newt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you say anything else? THE-PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I was saying to Bert and Mel,  if we relate the vector on a  parallelogram, allowing the azimuth to  intersect but not confirm the dimensional  factors contributing to the parameters of  the logarithmic module, it won't  necessarily be a part of it. Tidman turns back to Wally, almost relieved. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still an idiot. He gestures to the Goons.  One of them picks up the Profe Newt by the handle on his coat, the other takes his plaid TIDMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's his sock? (he shushes himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, let's not upset him. (quietly to Horton-as-Welly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got duplicates. Tidman is ready to lead the others into the Manor, when h Horton-as-Wally is still standing there. TIDMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't want to ... come in,  did you, Wally? HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say? TIDMAN (shocked, instantly cowed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, would you like to come in? HORTON-AS-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would I want to go in there  for?  I got a home of my own, pal. Horton-as-Wally cooly gets into the car and drives away. frowns, perplexed, then escorts the Goons and the Profess into the Manor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tidman leads the Professor-as-Newt, his feet barely touch floor, half-carried by Ike and Mike, into the grand foyer Manor Staff is assembled like shock troops about to charg trenches.  Some wear chest protectors, others shin guards carry cans of Mace and stun guns.  The Professor-as-Newt them with growing excitement. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT (to Tidman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could show me to my room  I'll start work immediately. TIDMAN (apprehensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you have planned, Master  Newt? THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know from my letters, I hope  to make a massive breakthrough.  It  came to me while contemplating a  large, smooth concrete floors. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Master Newt. (aside, to an Aide)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Gordon Cole on the phone; I want  a complete inventory of all our floor  systems. The Aid moves off, Ike and Mike start carting the Profess up the grand staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive office building, across the street from and nea identical to Company "B".  On the roof is a gigantic yell "A"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo tears up in a series of short, brutal stops and Tremendous grinding SOUNDS, billowing smoke, the throttle fan belt screaming. SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out quick before he kills us.  (screams at Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO MORE TEA!  I'll speak with you at home. dialogues.text: Gentlemen, may I present Professor Hugo  Zinzermacher. Polite applause.  Newt-as-the Professor beams, still hold Trick Dog in one hand and his dirty, bulging sock in the Delbert Corrigan steps forward to shake his hand, accompa young, blonde bombshell wife, SIMONE. SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE

dialogues.text: Professor, I'd like you to meet the  President of Company "A", Mr. Delbert Corrigan and his lovely wife, Simone. Corrigan shakes Newt-as-the Professor's hand.  Newt-as-th won't let go, happily pumping away. DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of the proudest moments  of my life.  I can safely say I speak  for everyone here when I tell you that  with you pulling your oar in our shell  we'll be at the mouth of the Charles  before you can sing three bars of the  Whiffenpoof song.  Just dandy. (getting a little uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know my wife, Simone? Simone, in a devastating little Chanel number, steps forw SIMONE (bad Radcliffe French)

His eyes light up like a pinball machine, h back and throws a roundhouse right.  Simon and Delbert, u good genetic reflexes, both shy back in shock.  The punch them and lands squarely on Mel's nose with a resounding S Mel grabs his broken honker, tears squirt from his eyes. the nearest wall and a piercing, high-pitched, one-note w contained agony escapes from him.  Mel turns back around. BERT (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor hit Mel. Holding his nose, Mel turns back to them, in extreme pain feeling somehow responsible for it. MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have provoked him.  Everyone else is still speechless. NEWT-AS-THE PROFESSOR (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I pee? DELBERT CORRIGAN (trying to smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, C.A.N.A.P.E. (he refers to his CANAPE security badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please be assured, the Center for Advanced  Nucleacly Arbitrary Permutation Experimentation  is absolutely thrilled to have you here.  Please,  be assured of this. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I pee? DELBERT CORRIGAN (slight pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should'a let him go when he  got off the plane. SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE (also trying to explain)
