The Company "A" limo with Bob McNabb at the wheel skids i weaving in and out between the trucks, sending Delivery M their loads skyward.  In hot pursuit are "Sherlock" Watso patrol car and the army jeeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Biggs looks down at the trucks through a pair of bino follows a dolly into Company "A", looks up through the bi and sees Delbert Corrigan looking at him through a pair o binoculars from Company "A" window.  They look at each ot through the binoculars for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the supervision of Bert, Mel and Sammy "the Stomp"- Newt-as-the-Professor is slowly and carefully packing his back in his sock.  The Trick Dog jumps back and forth ove BERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That flight back to Zurich's leaving in  less than an hour, Professor. MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long can it take to pack a sock? SAMMY "THE STOMP"-AS-ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you how long it takes to pack a suitcase. (dabs eyes with handkerchief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can either of you recommend a good  marriage counselor? BERT (pause, embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't seem to remember the Professor  having a dog on the plane, do you Mel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers in blue Company "A" jumpsuits scramble like beave assembling a large blue "pig" bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers in yellow Company "B" jumpsuits scamper around th yellow "pig" bomb they're quickly putting together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire House Staff lies unconscious on the floor.  Ik feeling woozy, sit with cold compresses on their heads. downing his third pitcher of martinis, straight from the Grandad listens to his record player, wheeling himself ar circle.  The Professor-as-Newt sits watching the countdow his coffee. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT (to Tidman, gallows humor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear the one about the farmer/ scientist? TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a long joke? THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, we have time.  Anyway, this farmer/ scientist.  He was outstanding in his unified  field. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Tidman finishes the pitcher.  We see the countdown is dow 00:06:10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countdown on the satellite continues, not t-minus 00: counting.  A few "Cheese is Made From Milk" wrappers floa the distance, the cheese asteroid is tumbling around in s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picture of the perfect, happy family.  Horton-as-Wally beam, as Polly serves them each a plate of small deliciou pies.  A "Vinnie's Take-Out" bag is on the table.  Horton sneaks a piece of green pie under the table to Gucci-Gucc Pekingese, who does a backflip of appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Gangsters turn out batch after batch of green pies kitchen, Wally-as-Horton and Lorraine circulate around th packed dining room, where satisfied, head-bobbing Custome gorging themselves on green pies and red wine. CUSTOMERS (variously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best pie I ever ate ... couldn't believe something that looked so simple  could taste so good ... the aroma, the  flavor, I'm in seventh heaven ... I'll  never eat at home again ... Mr. Biggs and his two Bodyguards stride in and corner Wal Horton. MR. BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I pay for a killing, I expect  somebody to die and Thursby, your  number just came up. The Bodyguards pull out pistols and point them at Wally-a Wally-as-Horton snakes out his hands and grabs both Bodyg the adam's apple. WALLY-AS-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put those away before somebody gets hurt! BODYGUARDS (Munchkined)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir, Mr. Thursby. WALLY-AS-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down and have some green pie, which  we recommend with the house red for a  particularly pleasing taste sensation. The Bodyguards immediately sit and Lorraine sets pies and front of them. MR. BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, who do you think -- WALLY-AS-HORTON (puts a finger in Biggs' face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. (grabs Biggs by the throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be no more killing in this town. MR. BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree completely. WALLY-AS-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, behave yourself and have  some delicious green pie and red wine. MR. BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to it. Vinnie enters, holding up a handful of paperwork. VINNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the contracts prepared. I've decided to make you all full  partners.  I'll have the fellas sign  first, then you, okay Horton? WALLY-AS-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's jake with me.  Partner. Vinnie enters the kitchen.  Lorraine embraces Wally-as-Ho LORRAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton, I always knew you were a  strong man.  I always knew you had  courage.  But this new tenderness ... it's  ... it's ... (she cries sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love you ever so much. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tidman is swaying at attention, singing "Nearer My God to Professor-as-Newt is counting down with the bomb. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is, less than a minute now. Fifty-nine, fifty-eight -- isn't it  interesting how time passes so much  more slowly at moments like this -- (a hint of wistful regret)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time to solve that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skaters have skated away during the night, buzzsaving through the floor and an additional five feet of bedrock. mass of hands is visible through the thick dust, circling The roar is louder than Niagara Falls. Woody and Big Tom are dumbfounded, nearly catatonic, glue chairs, eyes bugging out of their heads as they stare at spectacle.  Randy, standing nearby, completely oblivious transpired, still obsessed by the one detail which plague RANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still smell gas, Big Tom. Woody's chair breaks, splinters out from under him and fa He remains frozen in a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General-Conrad, Colonel Mofler and the Generals are ensco concrete bunker, all wearing strange goggles.  A SOLDIER think copies of the Washington, D.C. phonebook. COLONEL MOFLER (watching his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-minus fifteen ... fourteen ... (etc.) GENERAL CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitch up those phonebooks, boys,  no telling what this sucker'll do to your procreative recreational  system. The Soldiers all hold the phonebooks over their crotches. Conrad already has one taped to the crotch of his cast. GENERAL CONRAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check that tape for me, Mofler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the satellite countdown:  00:00:03 / 00:00:02 / 00 and as it hits 00:00:00 the beeping crescendos and goes  SILENT for one brief moment.  Then, the satellite produce an emission.; we see a small burst of light shoot from th nozzle and hear a sound like a sharp slam on a ping-pong  ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE, looking down on the United States.  The emiss short piece of light, enters the earth's atmosphere and h towards Kansas.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A mile above Newtonville, looking straight down at the ce town.  The emission descends down, strikes the center of giant "X" of light forms over the entire city.  From the the "X", a line of light spirals out like a watch spring. reaches the edge of town the entire "X" rotates 90 degree stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of his passionate kiss with Lorraine, Wally disappears and it replaced by the Professor-as-Newt-now-H stops kissing Lorraine.  We notice that the green pies ha red and the red wine has turned green.  Alice-as-Sammy "t is now singing an operatic aria. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT-NOW-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me clarify something; am I in Heaven? Are you an Angel? LORRAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I mean?  These days you say the  sweetest things.  And who ever knew you  were such a wonderful cook.  I hope this  doesn't frighten you, but I suddenly find  myself filled with maternal longings. THE PROFESSOR-AS-NEWT-NOW-HORTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frighten me?  It's the best news I've had  since the discovery of sub-atmoic particles. She looks at him with the slightest touch of curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying his sock, Newt-as-the-Professor moves down a lin the hands of Company "A" employees as he departs.  The Tr Bert, Mel and Sammy "the Stomp"-as-Alice trail behind him Just as he reaches Delbert Corrigan and Simone, Newt-as-t Professor disappears and Wally-as-Horton-now-the-Professo in his place.  The Trick Dog is the only one who notices he growls and bites Wally-as-Horton-now-the Professor's a Wally-as-Horton-now-the Professor points a finger and gla bumblebee eyes at him; the Trick Dog leaps up into his ar licks his face.  Delbert Corrigan extends a hand. DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, it's been an absolute delight -- WALLY-AS-HORTON-NOW-THE-PROFESSOR (with a finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, that was absolutely the worst cafeteria food I've ever tasted in my life. Delbert Corrigan shrinks back, shocked.  Simone aggressiv intercedes. SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a lotta nerve, you fruitcake -- WALLY-AS-HORTON-NOW-THE-PROFESSOR (the finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. She slams on the brakes. WALLY-AS-HORTON-NOW-THE-PROFESSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two ought to spend a little more time  thinking about tenderness.  And cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally-as-Horton-now-the Professor moves along the line, l bewildered Corrigans behind. DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should try a little tenderness. Sammy "the Stomp"-as-Alice, as if in a trance, sings "Try Tenderness", ala Otis Redding. SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delbert, have you ever seen a woman my  age do something like this? She leaps up, grabs the pipe of the sprinkler system and arm chin-up. DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely a little tenderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton-as-Wally sits at the dinner table with Polly and G Horton-as-Wally disappears and Newt-as-the Professor-now- appears in his place.  They look at each other.  The pies and the wine is green. NEWT-AS-THE PROFESSOR-NOW-WALLY (struggling to form the words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ... so ... happy. POLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I, darling. GORDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too, Dad.  I feel so good about  our family. NEWT-AS-THE PROFESSOR-NOW-WALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I pee? POLLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you can, Wally. Newt-as-the Professor-now-Wally rises and starts towards bathroom.  Gucci-Gucci leaps into his arms and licks his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor-as-Newt vanishes from his place beside the where the countdown is at: 00:00:16.  Horton-as-Wally-now Professor appears in his place, near a completely sloshed The "pig" is emitting an irritation whining noise that ri pitch and intensity. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it shall be a finer place we go to, leaving behind this veil  of tears -- (countdown at:00:00:09)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where our fortunes rise and fall on the seas of destiny like a tiny  ship, where an action once set in  motion cannot be reversed -- Mother,  I'll be home soon, in fact ... (squints at the countdown)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in about another three seconds -- HORTON-AS-WALLY-NOW-THE PROFESSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your horses, tea bag, we're not  going anywhere. Horton-as-Wally-now-the Professor whips out his .357 Magn drills the "Pig" right between the "eyes".  The "pig's" j open and a loud "oink" escapes.  The irritating noise cut the countdown stops; the last second stopping halfway to Tidman looks over at him, looks at the "pig", looks back as-Wally-now-the Professor. TIDMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini, Master Newt? HORTON-AS-WALLY-NOW-THE PROFESSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaken not stirred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skaters heads are visible, going around and around th roar is louder than two Niagara Falls. Woody and Big Tom remain staring at it, catatonically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing "X" over Newtonville vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army officers remove their goggles and peak out over of the bunker.  The smoke and dust clear, revealing the s Texans and Chinese Acrobats seated on folding chairs, in raised dais, where Mayor Billy Benson addressed them over system, with "Hail to the Chief" playing in background. MAYOR BILLY BENSON (oratorical fervor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One office ... one man/ One world ... one people. Three army jeeps shoot by in reverse, followed by "Sherlo in the patrol car and the Company "A" limo, also in rever in front of the bunker turns to the Generals and lets out yodel. General Conrad turns to Colonel Mofler. GENERAL CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pee again. COLONEL MOFLER (into a field phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pee again! Through the smoke we see the tap dancing Heinz 57 bottle, complicated time steps down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nozzle on the satellite lets go with another emission of light zips past the floating cheese meteor and heads t Earth.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A mile above Newtonville, looking straight down at the ce From the center of the "X", a line of light spirals out l spring.  When it reaches the edge of town the entire "X" another 90 degrees, stops and hovers over the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels on the sign lazily revolve.  The roar from ins gone.  Birds sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skaters are gone.  The crater where the rink once sto The silence is shattering.  Freed from their trance, Big Woody blink at the emptiness.  Big Tom shakes his head, e from a deep confusion. WOODY (not without bitterness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ridin' high in April ... shot down in May. Over to the side, with a look of sudden alarm, is Randy. RANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Tom, I still smell -- Randy spontaneously combusts, leaving behind a small pile a pear-shaped smudge on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Generals climb out of the bunker and the dust clears, empty chairs in front of the dais.  They move up to close standing in front of the bunker.  It moos. COLONEL MOFLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it worked. GENERAL CONRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just goes to prove an old saying of mine: two wrongs don't make a right.  But three  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight, birds, shady trees.  Peace.  In the far distanc foursome of GOLFERS on the green of the fifteenth hole of Newtonville Country Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horton-as-Wally-now-the Professor disappears and Newt, ju takes his place, holding his sock, a piece of green pie a The room is empty, except for Tidman, slouched in a chair Grandad, who turns around in his wheelchair, sees Newt an short.  They look at each other and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bolt of lightning shoots down out of the clear blue sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lightning bolt zaps through an open window and strike NEWT (blinking his eyes, articulate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandfather, the stars and funny  animals are gone.  Grandfather, I have  so many things to tell you. Tidman tries to clear his head, can't believe what he's s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the GOLFERS, now on the sixteenth tee, hits his dr towering smash that we follow up into the air, slicing se the right and heading directly for a window on the second the manor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWT  (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to live here with you, with you and Tidman, Chef Pierre and the rest of  the staff, forever and ever and -- The golf ball smashes through the window and hits Newt in His eyes get that starry/funny animal look again.  He smi NEWT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock-'em-sock-'em. Grandad turns to Tidman, points at Newt and smiles. GRANDAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Newt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Generals and Colonel Mofler, gathered off to the side their heads, toe the ground and mutter. General Conrad sits enveloped in the top of the giant che sending a slow burn towards the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buildings of Company "A" and Company "B" have merged giant green building, with the letters "AB" on top. Wally-as-Horton-now-the Professor is at the curb with Ber Alice (just Alice) and the Professor's bag.  Wally-as-Hor Professor disappears and the Professor, just the Professo in his place. The limo pulls up, looking brand new, with the insignia " door.  The three Chefs and the Tap Dancing Heinz 57 Bottl out.  Bob McNabb, behind the wheel, waves to Alice. BOB McNABB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, ducks. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, love.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Looking down on Newtonville, the large, glowing "X" disap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor is just about to get into the limo when we raucous alarm blaring from the green building and the Sci we've seen, from both Companies, come running out, all we jumpsuits. SCIENTISTS (variously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him!  ...  Professor!  We have an  emergency! ...  Don't let him get in  that car! ...  Bert and Mel, bring him  back inside! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For goodness sake, he'll miss his plane. SCIENTIST #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't going to be any planes if  he doesn't get inside fast! BERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, will you come with us please? MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an inconvenience, but it does sound  urgent. They pick him up by the elbows and hustle him back toward building.  They're followed by the three Chefs and the Ta Heinz 57 bottle. THE PROFESSOR (sets off a thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's yet another example; time was going by  so slowly and suddenly the universe seems to  curve back in on itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor is carried into a large room by Bert and Me along with the Scientists and the rest of the group that outside.  A nervous CROWD is gathered around a huge, gree headed "pig" bomb.  The countdown panel has slid open and countdown is counting down from: 00:00:27.  Beside it is chalkboard with a formula written on it: II x PIG^2 x C = (BOB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientists crowd around the Professor. SCIENTISTS (variously, accusing each other)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushed the button ... no, you pushed  the button ... it was an accident ... I didn't mean to do it ... SCIENTIST #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be a catastrophe of unprecedented proportion! THE PROFESSOR (sniffs the air, them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, you got it all wrong. The countdown continues.  The Professor sidles over to th blackboard and points to the formula. THE PROFESSOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain something (pointing to the formula)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Pi" times "permutations interacting  geometrically", and it goes without  saying arbitrarily -- The countdown is at:  00:00:12.  People are praying, weep ducking and covering. THE PROFESSOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- times the speed of light, which is  very fast I can tell you, equals -- (points to the first "b)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- bomb. A huge groan from the crowd. THE PROFESSOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- however, let me direct your attention to this little "2", do you see?  This means  "Pig" squared and we can clearly discern,  or Lucerne where my Grandmother's from, that  this pig had two heads.  Which brings us back  to "bob" -- b - o - b -- bomb or barbecue. The crowd is totally bewildered.  The countdown reaches z mouths of the "pig" heads drop open, we hear two loud "oi panel in the side of the "pig" slides open and a large ma sticky, brownish-red substance glops out onto the floor. lets out a collective sigh of relief.  An incredibly deli fills the air. THE PROFESSOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So unless I miss my guess we are looking  at and smelling the best barbecue sauce  in the whole darned world. The three Chefs are the first to step forward, filled wit trepidation and envy.  They cautiously dip their fingers sauce and taste it.  The incredibly delicious sauce compl overwhelms them. CHEF #1 (almost in tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years we at Heinz have been  searching for a sauce like this. CHEF#2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manna from heaven. The crowd presses forward to taste the sauce, which quick degenerates into a spectacle not unlike a frenzied pack o feeding on a bloated zebra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a nearby fallout shelter, Mr. Biggs and Delbert Corrig big goggles and blast suits, watch the above proceedings monitors. MR. BIGGS (speaks over an intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the phone to Heinz now' we'll deal, we'll deal -- don't  eat all that sauce, don't let them  eat all that sauce -- DELBERT CORRIGAN (overlapping, on a phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Heinz, Mr. Heinz, we have the  ultimate sauce -- no, not just steak  sauce, it'll go on everything --  (covers the phone, over intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat all that sauce!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd continues to feed.  The Professor stands alone, Bert and Alice.  The Professor, tracking down another tho whistles, grabs a handful of empty air and snaps his fing THE PROFESSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time. BERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is time.  Professor -- MEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we hurry you can still catch your plane. They pick him up by the elbows and hustle him out.  Alice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert and Mel carry the Professor towards the limo. THE PROFESSOR (snapping his fingers, to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time (he whistles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time. MR. BIGG'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one minute! DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, hold on! They stop.  Mr. Biggs, Delbert Corrigan and Simone rush o building to them.  Biggs and Corrigan wear green suits, S some green, high-fashion weirdness. DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, Company "AB" is prepared to offer you a seven figure contract -- MR. BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stock options, access to the corporate jet -- DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First rate health and dental coverage -- MR. BIGGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your own key to the executive washroom. DELBERT CORRIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For life. THE PROFESSOR (looks them up and down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do. (he shakes their hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Professor Hugo Zinzermacher. Hugo your way, und I'll go mine. The Professor gets into the limo, turns back to Mel and B gives them a big smile. THE PROFESSOR (CONT'D) (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas/ Everywhere I go ... (and so on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
